title: Identify B vs N from successive ionization energy

content.prompt: The first five ionization energies of a second-period element are listed in the table above. Which of the following correctly identifies the element and best explains the data in the table?

choices.label: B, because it has five core electrons
B, because it has three valence electrons
N, because it has five valence electrons
N, because it has three electrons in the p sublevel

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
